snippet: The department anticipates it will have enough burial space until 2050, when 2.6 million veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan begin to reach old age.
abstract: Department of Veterans Affairs completes purchase of 132 acres of undeveloped farmland in Upstate New York as final resting place for World War II veterans; plan is to create the last national cemetery for veterans to be built for the next 40 years.
lead_paragraph: The department anticipates it will have enough burial space until 2050, when 2.6 million veterans of Iraq and Afghanistan begin to reach old age.

headline.main: Buying Upstate New York Land, V.A. Closes Chapter in Building Cemeteries
headline.print_headline: Buying Upstate New York Land, V.A. Closes Chapter in Building Cemeteries
